How do yo install the Spectrum Library into vscode?

image1165×524 27.8 KB

I tried it this way, but It keeps telling me that there it can’t find the spectrum library.
Do you guys know how to fix this problem?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-06-17T16:12:02.910Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":201,"reads":257,"readers_count":256,"score":1056.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":438255,"topic_slug":"spectrum-framework","display_username":"Edward Lei","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/9/898cd86faddeff431bf99f229c7f0d3afd650fc6.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53533,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/spectrum-framework/438255/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3214774,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-17T18:44:31.758Z","cooked":"

You need to setup jitpack as a repository.

github.com

Spectrum3847/2023-X-Ray/blob/main/build.gradle#L53


      
    
          
  1. 
          
  2. // Set to true to use debug for JNI.
    3. 
          
  3. wpi.java.debugJni = false
    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5. // Set this to true to enable desktop support.
    6. 
          
  6. def includeDesktopSupport = true
    7. 
          
  7. 
          
  8. //Add Jitpack to be able to pull github repots into the project
    9. 
          
  9. repositories {
    10. 
          
  10.     mavenCentral()
    11. 
          
  11.     maven { url 'https://jitpack.io' }
    12. 
          
  12.     maven {
    13. 
          
  13.         url = uri("https://maven.pkg.github.com/Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageKit")
    14. 
          
  14.         credentials {
    15. 
          
  15.             username = "Mechanical-Advantage-Bot"
    16. 
          
  16.             password = "\u0067\u0068\u0070\u005f\u006e\u0056\u0051\u006a\u0055\u004f\u004c\u0061\u0079\u0066\u006e\u0078\u006e\u0037\u0051\u0049\u0054\u0042\u0032\u004c\u004a\u006d\u0055\u0070\u0073\u0031\u006d\u0037\u004c\u005a\u0030\u0076\u0062\u0070\u0063\u0051"
    17. 
          
  17.         }
    18. 
          
  18.     }
    19. 
          
  19. }
    20. 
          
  20. 
          
  21. //AdvantageKit code
    22.

Word of warning, you are free to use it but we didn’t really set it up nor maintain it in a way for other teams to use directly. You’re likely better off just copying the files you want directly into your own projects. We find bugs that we have to go into the library to fix and since you don’t have edit access you may end up in a place where something doesn’t work and you don’t have a convenient way to fix it.

This was our first year running the library this way, and it needs a lot of updates to be more compatible with the 2023 WPILib changes, several modifications were just bandaids to get us through the season.
